definition: a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); everything has its ancestral home/In old age, an expatriate longs to return home.
leaf/page/lobe/(historical) period/classifier for small boats
surname Ye
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
fig. a tree may grow a thousand zhang high, but its leaves return to their roots (proverb)/fig. everything has its ancestral home/in old age, an expatriate returns home
pinyin: shu4 gao1 qian1 zhang4 , ye4 luo4 gui1 gen1

sentences.english: I am a European, and one returns to one's roots .
sentences.chinese: 我是個歐洲人，總要葉落歸根。

sentences.english: People often say" put down roots".
Returning to their roots on the maternal grandmother is also a.
sentences.chinese: 對外婆而言也是葉落歸根了。

at one's ease/carefree
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
quiet and comfortable
to cross (a road, an ocean etc)/to cut across
to know how to count and do sums/numerate/numeracy
fairyland/honorific: your homeland
can't be bought for one thousand in gold (idiom)
to bewail one's poverty/to complain about being hard up/to pretend to be poor
root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
sound dissipation/noise reduction
